intro: Tibetiodes lipskii, commonly known as the Tibetan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments and thrives at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
